snippet: A luxury retail and residential development built in the shadow of the Salt Lake Temple draws visitors and shoppers, but gets mixed reactions from Mormons.
abstract: City Creek Center, luxury mall and residential development built in the shadow of the Salt Lake Temple, draws visitors and shoppers, but gets mixed reactions from Mormons; mall in Salt Lake City, Utah, helped downtown retail sales increase by 36 percent, or $209 million, in 2012, and was financed entirely by the church.

byline.contributor: Cadence Woodland contributed reporting from Salt Lake City.

lead_paragraph: A luxury retail and residential development built in the shadow of the Salt Lake Temple draws visitors and shoppers, but gets mixed reactions from Mormons.

headline.main: Mormon-Backed Mall Breathes Life into Salt Lake City
headline.print_headline: Mormon-Backed Mall Breathes Life Into Salt Lake City

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject
